meanings.definition: To exist or occur at a date earlier than (something).
meanings.sent1: The discovery of ancient fossils predated the invention of modern technology.
meanings.sent2: In history, the Stone Age predated the Bronze Age.
meanings.sent3: It's like finding out your grandparents predated the invention of sliced bread!
meanings.sent4: The wisdom of the wise predates the knowledge of the young.
meanings.sent5: The legend of the lost city predates written records, shrouded in mystery.

meanings.definition: To precede in time; come before.
meanings.sent1: The sunrise predates the start of the morning rush hour.
meanings.sent2: The construction of the pyramids predates the birth of Jesus.
meanings.sent3: His habit of arriving early predates his love for punctuality.
meanings.sent4: The melody of the song predates the lyrics, setting the tone.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of freshly baked bread predates the first bite, teasing the senses.
